hackathon-description-text: Do you have a great idea for an Infusionsoft App, integration or plug-in that will enhance the Infusionsoft user experience? Then you have a shot at being crowned the
hackathon-rules:
The following is a summary of the competition process and rules. For full details, please see the Official Rules ("Rules") below.  In the case of a conflict between this Summary and the Rules, the Rules control.
                                      i.Richard Tripp, Chief Product Officer to discuss the ‘POV Method’
                                     ii.Marc Chesley, Chief Technology Officer to discuss ‘Development Execution’
                                    iii.Greg Head, Chief Marketing Officer to discuss ‘Branding and Marketing’
                                      i.InfusionCon Marketing Package
                                     ii.Login Notification (advertisement) to Infusionsoft users
                                    iii.Website reference: highlight and feature
                                   iv.Premium placement in
                                    v.Literature reference of winning App
                                   vi.Digital badge as the Kick Apps Champion
                                      i.InfusionCon Marketing Package
                                     ii.In-App Notification to Infusionsoft users
                                    iii.Website reference: highlight and feature
                                   iv.Premium placement in
                                    v.Literature reference of winning App
                                   vi.Digital badge as a Battle of the Apps finalist

                                     ii.Login Notification (advertisement) to Infusionsoft users
                                    iii.Website reference: highlight and feature
                                   iv.Premium placement in
                                    v.Literature reference of winning App
                                   vi.Digital badge as a Battle of the Apps finalist

                                     ii.Login Notification (advertisement) to Infusionsoft users

This table lists a summary of important dates in the Battle of the Apps Contest.
 
 
 


6.1          TEAMS CONTESTANTS: If a Contestant enters as part of a team, the Contestant understands and agrees that, in order for his/her team to be eligible to participate, all of the members of the team must register and accept the Rules. The Contestants assume the responsibility for identifying each member of a team at the time the team submits its Entry, and Infusionsoft does not assume any responsibility for checking the identification of team members. The members of a team that are identified with the submission of an Entry shall be final and that team may not add, remove or substitute members, or otherwise change the composition of the team, for the duration of the Competition. Furthermore, a Contestant that is part of a team understands and agrees that if his/her team is selected to receive a prize, each Contestant on the team is responsible for ensuring the prize is appropriately distributed to each member of the team. Finally, in order to remain eligible to win a prize, the team and each member of that team must satisfy the eligibility requirements in these Rules, including the submission of a Contest Prize Validation Agreement (discussed below); if one member of the team does not comply with these Rules or is disqualified, the team as a whole will be disqualified.
6.2          BUSINESS CONTESTANTS: Infusionsoft encourages entries from United States businesses and other United States legal entities. If an Entry is submitted on behalf of a United States corporation, limited liability company, partnership or other legal entity (any of which being referred to as a "Business Entity"), the Contestant(s) submitting the Entry hereby certifies to Infusionsoft that (1) the appropriate authorization from the corporate officers, executives, managers or other required persons or group has been obtained, (2) the individual Contestants are in some manner legally associated with the Business Entity and (3) the individual accepting the Rules on behalf of the Business Entity is authorized to legally bind the Business Entity. A Business Entity submitting an Entry shall be legally bound by these Rules by the act of the Contestant(s) acting on its behalf. Each Contestant associated with and/or submitting an Entry for or on behalf of a Business Entity acknowledges and agrees that if the Contestant enters the Competition without obtaining the requisite authorization, Infusionsoft may, in its sole discretion, disqualify the Business Entity and any submitted Entry. Finally, if a Business Entity is selected to receive a prize, a corporate officer or other authorized person entitled to bind the Business Entity will be required to execute and deliver the Contest Prize Validation Agreement on behalf of the Business Entity.
7.1          The complete submission must be made before 10:00 P.M. Eastern Standard Time on December 31, 2012 (the “Competition Entry Deadline”). You may update your submission at any time prior to the Competition Entry Deadline using the same entry process as your original submission. Please indicate on when you are submitting an updated submission. Infusionsoft will accept only the most recent submission and disregard any older submissions.
7.2           Each Contestant must provide complete and accurate information as required at the Infusionsoft Competition Entry page, including a valid working email address. The contact person for the Competition for such Entry will be the authorized account holder of the email address provided at the time of Entry. The "authorized account holder" is the natural person assigned to an email address by the provider of such email service.
7.3          The submission must be an original work of the Contestant that includes a technical integration with the Infusionsoft platform, using the Infusionsoft API or other method described on the Infusionsoft Developers site. In addition, any application with respect to which Infusionsoft has provided any substantial development assistance is ineligible. Substantial development assistance includes Infusionsoft providing any of the following:
Substantial development assistance does not include Infusionsoft providing answers to technical questions posted in the developer forum, Infusionsoft offering support found through its developer center, or Infusionsoft providing documentation through Github or its developer center. 
7.4          The submitted application must be executable so that the Judges may evaluate it through use with the production Infusionsoft service. For iOS applications, Infusionsoft will provide a list of IDs (UDIDs) for the devices that the Judges will be using to evaluate the Entry on the Infusionsoft website at http://battleoftheapps.infusionsoft.com.
7.5          The submission must be accompanied by a video describing and demonstrating the application, which will be the primary basis on which Judges will evaluate the submission when selecting the four finalists. The video should be no longer than three minutes and it cannot violate the Infusionsoft Terms of Service applicable to user “Content.” The video should be in the form of a hyperlink to a YouTube or Vimeo video that can be easily played over the internet.
7.6          A submissions must, at a minimum, support English language use but may also support other languages at the discretion of the Contestant.
7.7          Any submission that contains (1) sexual, violent, abusive, harassing, offensive or insulting content or (2) enables or promotes any illegal activity or (3) infringes any other party’s legal rights may be disqualified.
7.8          Any false information provided within the context of the Competition by any Contestant including information concerning identity, mailing address, telephone number, email address or ownership of right, or non-compliance with these Rules, or the like may result in the immediate elimination of the Contestant from the Competition.
7.9         
7.10       Submissions shall not require any fee or expense to be incurred by the Judges and must be provided with the license rights described in these Rules.
8.1          Judging will be conducted in three rounds. 
FINAL SCORING: The Finalist Judges' individual rankings will be totaled and shall count for two-thirds of the final score.  The other one-third of the final score will be determined by the audience voting. The top four prizes will then be awarded in the order of highest-total final score. In the event of ties, the Entry with the highest Finalist Judges score will be the winner of the tie.  
TOP AWARD WINNER ANNOUNCEMENT:  Infusionsoft will announce the Kick Apps Champion, Second, Third, and Fourth Place prize winners at the InfusionCon 2013.  The announcement will occur during InfusionCon 2013, to be held on March 29, 2013. In addition, all winners will be posted online by April 1, 2013 at 
 and http://www.infusionblog.com. Winners do not have to be present at the InfusionCon 2013 announcement to win.
8.2          The judges shall consider five equally-weighted criteria when judging:
 
8.3          Each Finalist and App Innovator will be informed by email of required materials and documentation that must be submitted for marketing material and, if applicable, presentations for the InfusionCon 2013 by March 1, 2013. All submissions will be reviewed and, if deemed appropriate, approved. Infusionsoft reserves the right, at its sole discretion to reject submissions for any reason.
8.4          A Contestant may be disqualified and selection of an alternate prize recipient will be made if, in Infusionsoft's sole discretion, should any of the following apply: a Contestant fails to meet deadlines, respond in any time period specified in the email notification, fails to comply with Infusionsoft material or documentation change request(s), or Infusionsoft reasonably believes Contestant is unwilling or unable to maintain the high standard of InfusionCon. If any Contestant selected as a prize recipient is disqualified for any reason, the next highest-scoring Contestant will be designated as the recipient of that prize.
9.1           Infusionsoft will award the following prizes:
The all-expenses paid day at Infusionsoft covers one night’s stay at a hotel of Infusionsoft's selection, two-day car rental and a per diem allowance for food (total expenses not to exceed $500).
9.2           All Prizes are contingent on Contestant's compliance with these Rules.
9.3          Infusionsoft is not responsible for decisions on the division or distribution of any prize among or between team members or Business Entities or team Entries. Instead, the decision on how to distribute or divide any prize among individual team members or within Business Entities is the sole responsibility of the participating team or Business Entity. Each Contestant hereby expressly waives any claim they may have against Infusionsoft relating to the division of any prize among team members or Business Entities and expressly agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Infusionsoft from and against any and all claims relating to such allocation of prizes and agrees that Infusionsoft may offset against the amount of any prize to be awarded the amount of costs incurred by Infusionsoft, including any legal or other professional fees, arising from and relating to any such claim or dispute.
9.4          The payment to potential prize recipients is subject to the express requirement that the Contestant submit to Infusionsoft all documentation requested by Infusionsoft to permit it to comply with all applicable United States, state, local and foreign (including provincial) tax reporting and withholding requirements. Any prize will be net of any taxes Infusionsoft may be required to withhold (and Infusionsoft may rely upon the advice of its accountants to determine withholding, which decision shall be final and binding). The winning Contestant(s) shall be responsible for ensuring compliance with all the applicable tax laws and filing requirements and the payment of all taxes that may be assessed against the Contestant on account of their receipt of a prize. If a Contestant fails to comply with the requirements of these Rules, the right to receive the prize may be forfeited and Infusionsoft may, in its sole discretion, select an alternative prize recipient.
9.5          CONTEST PRIZE VALIDATION AGREEMENT: All Contestants who are App Innovator Finalists will be required to complete and enter into a Contest Prize Validation Agreement and/or other documents prior to being identified as a Finalist or receiving a prize. The Contest Prize Validation Agreement will contain (i) an affidavit as to the requirements for eligibility in the Competition, (ii) a publicity release providing Infusionsoft the right to use the Contestant’s name, likeness and/or appearance at the InfusionCon, the Infusionsoft web site and in related media promoting Infusionsoft, including the Competition and the InfusionCon, (iii) an indemnification agreement relating to any breach of warranties made by Contestant under these Rules and (iv) such other provisions that may be required to comply with laws applicable to the awarding of the prize, including tax requirements. If a team or Business Entity is selected as a potential prize recipient, all members of the team or a person with the authority to bind the Business Entity, must enter into the Contest Prize Validation Agreement, which will also provide how the prize should be awarded. Failure to comply with this requirement or to submit any of these documents within the time period specified in an email from Infusionsoft providing the Agreement may mean that the Entry will no longer be eligible to win the applicable prize and Infusionsoft may, in its sole discretion, select an alternative Contestant as an App Innovator Finalist and/or to receive the prize.
21.1      
21.2       All federal, state, provincial and local laws and regulations apply. Submission of Entry into this Competition deems that Contestants agree to be bound by these Rules and by the decisions of Infusionsoft, Administrator and the Judges, which are final and binding on all matters pertaining to this Competition. Under no circumstances shall the submission of an Entry in the Competition, the awarding of a prize or anything in these Rules be construed as an offer or contract of employment with Infusionsoft or Administrator. Failure to respond within any time period specified in the email notification of potential award of a prize may result in disqualification and selection of an alternate prize recipient. A Contestant may be prohibited from participating in this Competition if, in either Infusionsoft's sole discretion or Administrator’s sole discretion, either reasonably believes that the Contestant has attempted to undermine the legitimate operation of the Competition by cheating, deception or other unfair voting or other practices or annoys, abuses, threatens or harasses any other Contestants, Infusionsoft, Administrator or the Judges.
21.3       You acknowledge and understand that Infusionsoft, its business partners and others may independently develop applications that may be similar to or identical to your Entry in terms of idea, functionality or in other respects. You agree that you will not be entitled to any rights in, or compensation in connection with, any such similar or identical applications and/or ideas as a result of your submission of any application or description of any application in a video or other submission or communications with Infusionsoft. You acknowledge that you have submitted your Entry voluntarily and not in confidence or in trust. You acknowledge that no confidential, fiduciary, agency or other relationship or implied-in-fact contract now exists between you and Infusionsoft and that no such relationship is established by your registration in the Competition or any submission of an Entry to Infusionsoft under these Rules.
21.4       You acknowledge that Entries may be subject to United States export and import laws, regardless of location or nationality. You agree to comply with all applicable export and import controls, including, but not limited to, the United States Department of Commerce's Export Administration Regulations, sanctions programs administered by the United States Treasury Department's Office of Foreign Assets Control and any export laws applicable in your country of residence. You warrant that all of your Entries are authorized for import into, and export from, the United States under these laws.
v.2

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: - Mainstage time at InfusionCon 2013 to present the app
- Mainstage time at InfusionCon 2013 to present the app
- Mainstage time at InfusionCon 2013 to present the app
- Mainstage time at InfusionCon 2013 to present the app
- Two tickets to InfusionCon, shared booth with other app innovators (or applicable discount)

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the app help our small business customers succeed? Does this app appeal to a broad range of our target users?
Is the app polished, visually appealing? Is the app clear, intuitive and easy to learn and use?
Does the app offer a complete solution with deep use of Infusionsoft features? Does the app take advantage of the unique functionality Infusionsoft offers?
Is the app compelling and/or indispensable? Is this app something our target users will find useful in their business?
Is the app unique and/or innovative? Does the app present a novel solution or approach?

hackathon-description-header: Build the best app to help small businesses succeed!
